alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains including Bisbee, Canelo Hills, Madera Canyon; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson; White Mountains of Graham and Greenlee Counties including Hannagan Meadow (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 12:10AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Graham, central Cochise and west central Greenlee Counties through 115 AM MST... At 1209 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a broken line of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 17 miles north of Bisbee- Douglas Airport to 12 miles west of Morenci. Movement was west at 20 to 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Safford, Willcox, Thatcher, Solomon, Roper Lake State Park, Safford Regional Airport, Pearce-Sunsites, Pima, Cochise, Central, Elfrida, Fort Thomas, Sunizona, Kansas Settlement, Swift Trail Junction, Fort Grant, Mount Graham, Bonita and Frye Mesa Dam. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 328 and 364. Route 70 between mile markers 306 and 353. Route 181 between mile markers 39 and 49. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 353. Route 191 between mile markers 21 and 135. Route 266 between mile markers 105 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
